Sure! Let's identify the "Disease" entities in the given paragraph.

1. creatine kinase (CK) - This is not a disease entity. It is an enzyme that is often measured in blood tests to assess muscle damage.

2. CK-MB - This is not a disease entity either. CK-MB is a specific form of creatine kinase that is found mainly in the heart muscle.

3. cardiac troponin I (cTnI) - This is also not a disease entity. Cardiac troponin I is a protein that is released into the bloodstream when there is damage to the heart muscle.

Therefore, there are no disease entities mentioned in the given paragraph.
